intro: Ouratea anceps, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but often have astringent properties. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy, dark green appearance.
